casebody.data:
Wellborn, administrator, vs. Hood. 2. Where, during the term of a lease the landlord died, and at the expiration thereof the tenant moved from the premises, and in good faith abandoned possession, and another then took possession as .owner, that the tenant some time thereafter-rented from him and re-took possession as his tenant did not again render him a tenant of the original landlord or his representative. SPEER, Justice.

1. There was no error in this case which demands the grant of a new trial.
